remarks.format: ## Remarks XML 序列化是将对象的公共属性和字段转换为序列格式（这里是指 XML）以便存储或传输的过程。XML serialization is the process of converting an object's public properties and fields to a serial format (in this case, XML) for storage or transport. 反序列化通过 XML 输出在其原始状态中重新创建对象。Deserialization re-creates the object in its original state from the XML output. 可以将序列化视为一种将对象状态保存到流或缓冲区的方式。You can think of serialization as a way of saving the state of an object into a stream or buffer. 例如，ASP.NET 使用 类对 XML Web service 消息进行编码。For example, ASP.NET uses the class to encode XML Web service messages. 对象中的数据是用编程语言构造来描述的，如类、字段、属性、基元类型、数组，甚至 或 对象形式的嵌入 XML。The data in your objects is described using programming language constructs like classes, fields, properties, primitive types, arrays, and even embedded XML in the form of or objects. 您可以选择创建自己的类，用特性批注，或使用[XML 架构定义工具（xsd.exe）](/dotnet/standard/serialization/xml-schema-definition-tool-xsd-exe)基于现有的 xml 架构定义（xsd）文档生成类。You have the option of creating your own classes, annotated with attributes, or using the [XML Schema Definition Tool (Xsd.exe)](/dotnet/standard/serialization/xml-schema-definition-tool-xsd-exe) to generate the classes based on an existing XML Schema definition (XSD) document. 如果你有一个 XML 架构，则可以运行 Xsd.exe 来生成一组强类型化到架构的类，并在序列化时使用属性对其进行批注以遵循架构。If you have an XML Schema, you can run the Xsd.exe to produce a set of classes that are strongly typed to the schema and annotated with attributes to adhere to the schema when serialized. 若要在对象和 XML 之间传输数据，需要从编程语言构造到 XML 架构的映射，以及从 XML 架构到编程语言构造的映射。To transfer data between objects and XML requires a mapping from the programming language constructs to XML schema and from the XML schema to the programming language constructs. 和相关工具（如 Xsd.exe）在设计时和运行时中都提供了这两种技术之间的桥梁。The and related tools like Xsd.exe provide the bridge between these two technologies at both design time and runtime. 在设计时，使用 Xsd.exe 从自定义类生成 XML 架构文档（.xsd）或从给定的架构生成类。At design time, use the Xsd.exe to produce an XML schema document (.xsd) from your custom classes or to produce classes from a given schema. 在任一情况下，都用自定义特性对类进行批注，以指示 如何在 XML 架构系统和公共语言运行时之间进行映射。In either case, the classes are annotated with custom attributes to instruct the how to map between the XML schema system and the common language runtime. 在运行时，可以将类的实例序列化为遵循给定架构的 XML 文档。At runtime, instances of the classes can be serialized into XML documents that follow the given schema. 同样，可以将这些 XML 文档反序列化为运行时对象。Likewise, these XML documents can be deserialized into runtime objects. 请注意，XML 架构是可选的，不是在设计时或运行时所必需的。Note that the XML schema is optional, and not required at design time or runtime. ## 控制生成的 XMLControlling Generated XML 若要控制生成的 XML，可以将特殊属性应用于类和成员。To control the generated XML, you can apply special attributes to classes and members. 例如，若要指定不同的 XML 元素名称，请将 应用于公共字段或属性，并设置 属性。For example, to specify a different XML element name, apply an to a public field or property, and set the property. 有关类似属性的完整列表，请参阅[控制 XML 序列化的属性](/dotnet/standard/serialization/attributes-that-control-xml-serialization)。For a complete list of similar attributes, see [Attributes That Control XML Serialization](/dotnet/standard/serialization/attributes-that-control-xml-serialization). 还可以实现 接口来控制 XML 输出。You can also implement the interface to control the XML output. 如果生成的 XML 必须符合万维网联合会文档的第5节（[简单对象访问协议（SOAP） 1.1](https://www.w3.org/TR/2000/NOTE-SOAP-20000508/)），则必须使用 构造 。If the XML generated must conform to section 5 of the World Wide Consortium document, [Simple Object Access Protocol (SOAP) 1.1](https://www.w3.org/TR/2000/NOTE-SOAP-20000508/), you must construct the with an . 若要进一步控制编码的 SOAP XML，请使用[控制编码的 Soap 序列化的特性](/dotnet/standard/serialization/attributes-that-control-encoded-soap-serialization)中列出的属性。To further control the encoded SOAP XML, use the attributes listed in [Attributes That Control Encoded SOAP Serialization](/dotnet/standard/serialization/attributes-that-control-encoded-soap-serialization). 使用 可以利用强类型化类，但仍具有 XML 的灵活性。With the you can take advantage of working with strongly typed classes and still have the flexibility of XML. 使用强类型类中的类型 、 或 的字段或属性，可以直接将 XML 文档的某些部分读入 XML 对象。Using fields or properties of type , or in your strongly typed classes, you can read parts of the XML document directly into XML objects. 如果使用可扩展的 XML 架构，还可以使用 和 特性来序列化和反序列化在原始架构中找不到的元素或属性。If you work with extensible XML schemas, you can also use the and attributes to serialize and deserialize elements or attributes that are not found in the original schema. 若要使用这些对象，请将 应用到返回 对象的数组的字段，或将 应用于返回 对象数组的字段。To use the objects, apply an to a field that returns an array of objects, or apply an to a field that returns an array of objects. 如果属性或字段返回一个复杂对象（如数组或类实例），则 将其转换为嵌套在主 XML 文档内的元素。If a property or field returns a complex object (such as an array or a class instance), the converts it to an element nested within the main XML document. 例如，以下代码中的第一个类将返回第二个类的实例。For example, the first class in the following code returns an instance of the second class. ```vb Public Class MyClass Public MyObjectProperty As MyObject End Class Public Class MyObject Public ObjectName As String End Class ``` ```csharp public class MyClass { public MyObject MyObjectProperty; } public class MyObject { public string ObjectName; } ``` 序列化的 XML 输出如下所示：The serialized, XML output looks like this: ``` My String ``` 如果架构包含一个可选元素（minOccurs = "0"），或者架构包含默认值，则可以使用两个选项。If a schema includes an element that is optional (minOccurs = '0'), or if the schema includes a default value, you have two options. 一种选择是使用 来指定默认值，如下面的代码所示。One option is to use to specify the default value, as shown in the following code. ```vb Public Class PurchaseOrder _ Public Year As String End Class ``` ```csharp public class PurchaseOrder { [System.ComponentModel.DefaultValueAttribute ("2002")] public string Year; } ``` created in the form of `propertyNameSpecified`. 例如，如果有一个名为 "MyFirstName" 的字段，还会创建一个名为 "MyFirstNameSpecified" 的字段，该字段指示 是否生成名为 "MyFirstName" 的 XML 元素。For example, if there is a field named "MyFirstName" you would also create a field named "MyFirstNameSpecified" that instructs the whether to generate the XML element named "MyFirstName". 下面的示例说明了这一点。This is shown in the following example. Public FirstOrder As String ' Use the XmlIgnoreAttribute to ignore the ' special field named "FirstOrderSpecified". _ Public FirstOrderSpecified As Boolean End Class ``` ```csharp public class OptionalOrder { // This field should not be serialized // if it is uninitialized. public string FirstOrder; // Use the XmlIgnoreAttribute to ignore the // special field named "FirstOrderSpecified". [System.Xml.Serialization.XmlIgnoreAttribute] public bool FirstOrderSpecified; } ``` ## 重写默认序列化Overriding Default Serialization 您还可以通过创建一个适当的属性并将其添加到 类的实例中，重写任何一组对象及其字段和属性的序列化。You can also override the serialization of any set of objects and their fields and properties by creating one of the appropriate attributes, and adding it to an instance of the class. 以这种方式重写序列化具有两个用途：首先，可以控制和增加 DLL 中找到的对象的序列化，即使您不具有对源的访问权限也是如此。其次，您可以创建一组可序列化类，但可以通过多种方式序列化这些对象。Overriding serialization in this way has two uses: first, you can control and augment the serialization of objects found in a DLL, even if you do not have access to the source; second, you can create one set of serializable classes, but serialize the objects in multiple ways. 有关更多详细信息，请参阅 class that implements must implement a public `Add` method that takes a single parameter. `Add` 方法的参数必须与从 `GetEnumerator`返回的值的 `Current` 属性或该类型的基之一返回的类型相同。The `Add` method's parameter must be of the class that implements (such as ) in addition to must have a public `Item` indexed property (indexer in C#) that takes an integer, and it must have a public `Count` property of type integer. `Add` 方法的参数必须与从 `Item` 属性返回的类型相同，或者为该类型的基之一。The parameter to the `Add` method must be the same type as is returned from the `Item` property, or one of that type's bases. 对于实现 的类，要序列化的值是从索引的 `Item` 属性检索的，而不是通过调用 `GetEnumerator`来检索的。For classes that implement , values to be serialized are retrieved from the indexed `Item` property, not by calling `GetEnumerator`. 您必须具有写入临时目录（由 TEMP 环境变量定义）的权限，以便对对象进行反序列化。You must have permission to write to the temporary directory (as defined by the TEMP environment variable) to deserialize an object. ## 动态生成的程序集Dynamically Generated Assemblies 为了提高性能，XML 序列化基础结构会动态生成程序集以序列化和反序列化指定的类型。To increase performance, the XML serialization infrastructure dynamically generates assemblies to serialize and deserialize specified types. 基础结构查找并重用这些程序集。The infrastructure finds and reuses those assemblies. 仅当使用以下构造函数时，才会发生此行为：This behavior occurs only when using the following constructors: 如果使用其他任何构造函数，则将生成同一程序集的多个版本，并且永远不会卸载，这会导致内存泄漏和性能不佳。If you use any of the other constructors, multiple versions of the same assembly are generated and never unloaded, which results in a memory leak and poor performance. 最简单的解决方案是使用前面提到的两个构造函数之一。The easiest solution is to use one of the previously mentioned two constructors. 否则，你必须将程序集缓存到 中，如下面的示例中所示。Otherwise, you must cache the assemblies in a , as shown in the following example. ```csharp Hashtable serializers = new Hashtable(); // Use the constructor that takes a type and XmlRootAttribute. XmlSerializer s = new XmlSerializer(typeof(MyClass), myRoot); // Implement a method named GenerateKey that creates unique keys // for each instance of the XmlSerializer. The code should take // into account all parameters passed to the XmlSerializer // constructor. object key = GenerateKey(typeof(MyClass), myRoot); // Check the local cache for a matching serializer. XmlSerializer ser = (XmlSerializer)serializers[key]; if (ser == null) { ser = new XmlSerializer(typeof(MyClass), myRoot); // Cache the serializer. serializers[key] = ser; } // Use the serializer to serialize or deserialize. ``` ```vb Dim serializers As New Hashtable() ' Use the constructor that takes a type and XmlRootAttribute. Dim s As New XmlSerializer(GetType([MyClass]), myRoot) ' Implement a method named GenerateKey that creates unique keys ' for each instance of the XmlSerializer. The code should take ' into account all parameters passed to the XmlSerializer ' constructor. Dim key As Object = GenerateKey(GetType([MyClass]), myRoot) ' Check the local cache for a matching serializer. Dim ser As XmlSerializer = CType(serializers(key), XmlSerializer) If ser Is Nothing Then ser = New XmlSerializer(GetType([MyClass]), myRoot) ' Cache the serializer. serializers(key) = ser End If ' Use the serializer to serialize or deserialize. ``` ## ArrayList 和泛型列表的序列化Serialization of ArrayList and Generic List 无法序列化或反序列化以下内容：The cannot serialize or deserialize the following: - 的数组Arrays of - 的数组Arrays of ## 无符号 Long 的枚举的序列化Serialization of Enumerations of Unsigned Long 如果满足以下条件，则无法实例化 来序列化枚举：枚举的类型为无符号 long （`ulong` C#），且枚举包含值大于9223372036854775807的任何成员。The cannot be instantiated to serialize an enumeration if the following conditions are true: The enumeration is of type unsigned long (`ulong` in C#) and the enumeration contains any member with a value larger than 9,223,372,036,854,775,807. 例如，无法对以下项进行序列化。For example, the following cannot be serialized. ``` public enum LargeNumbers: ulong { a = 9223372036854775808 } // At runtime, the following code will fail. xmlSerializer mySerializer=new XmlSerializer(typeof(LargeNumbers)); ``` ## 已标记为已过时属性的对象不再序列化Objects marked with the Obsolete Attribute no longer serialized 在 [!INCLUDE[netfx35_short](~/includes/netfx35-short-md.md)] 类不再序列化标记为 `[Obsolete]`的对象。In the [!INCLUDE[netfx35_short](~/includes/netfx35-short-md.md)] the class no longer serializes objects that are marked as `[Obsolete]`. ## Examples 下面的示例包含两个主要类： `PurchaseOrder` 和 `Test`。The following example contains two main classes: `PurchaseOrder` and `Test`. `PurchaseOrder` 类包含有关单个购买的信息。The `PurchaseOrder` class contains information about a single purchase. `Test` 类包含创建采购订单的方法，并读取创建的采购订单。The `Test` class contains the methods that create the purchase order, and that read the created purchase order.
